sen.j: 青島（あおしま）は、京都府与謝郡伊根町の大間口340メートル、小間口120メートルを隔てて、伊根湾内に浮かぶ島。
sen.e: Aoshima Island is an island located within the Ine bay, in a distance of 340 m from one side of the main land of Ine-cho Town, Yosa-gun County, Kyoto Prefecture and in the distance of 120 m from the other side of the main land.
Aoshima Island is an island located within the Ine bay, 340 m from one side of the main land of Ine-cho Town, Yosa-gun County, Kyoto Prefecture and120 m from the other side of the main land.
Aoshima Island is an island located within the Ine bay, 340 m from one side of the main land of Ine-cho, Yosa-gun, Kyoto Prefecture and 120 m from the other side of the main land.
sen.cmt: town, county などを削除しました。

sen.j: 東西480メートル、南北200メートル、標高は最高点で48,3メートルとなっている。
sen.e: It is 480 m in the east-west direction and 200 m in the north-south direction, with a highest altitude of 48.3 m.
It is 480 m in the east-west direction and 200 m in the north-south direction, with its highest point reaching an altitude of 48.3 m.
It is 480 m in the east-west direction and 200 m in the north-south direction, with its highest point reaching an altitude of 48.3 m.

sen.j: 亀島半島の亀山岬から約150m沖合いに位置する。
sen.e: It is located at a 150-m offshore of Kameyama-misaki Cape of Kameshima-hanto Peninsula.
It is located 150-m offshore of Kameyama-misaki Cape of Kameshima-hanto Peninsula.
It is located 150-m offshore of Kameyama-misaki Cape of Kameshima Peninsula.

sen.j: 島内には神社があり、しばしば参拝客が訪問する。
sen.e: A shrine is placed there and is frequently visited by worshippers.
The shrine here is frequently visited by worshippers.
The shrine here is frequently visited by worshippers.

sen.j: また、青島は2つに分かれており、過去に魚類の養殖が存在した。
sen.e: Aoshima Island actually consists of two islands, and fishes were cultivared there in the past.
Aoshima Island actually consists of two islands, and fish were cultivared there in the past.
Aoshima Island in fact consists of two islands, and fish were cultivated there in the past.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。"actually" -> "in fact"

sen.j: 現在は、両方の島を橋で結んでいる。
sen.e: At present, the two islands are connected with bridges.
At present, the two islands are connected with bridges.
At present, the two islands are connected with bridges.

sen.j: 青島は伊根浦だけでなく、丹後海沿岸地域の漁民にとって、“聖なる島”、信仰の対象とされている。
sen.e: Aoshima Island is worshipped as "a secrad island" not only by fishermen in the Ine bay bu also those in the areas slong the Tango seashore.
Aoshima Island is worshipped as "a secret island" not only by fishermen in the Ine bay but also those in the areas slong the Tango seashore.
Aoshima Island is worshipped as "a secret island" not only by fishermen in the Ine bay but also those in the areas along the Tango seashore.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: これは漁民・海洋関係者の信仰の対象である蛭子神社が祭られていることにある。
sen.e: This is because Ebisu-jinja Shrine worshipped by fishermen and sea-related persons is located there.
This is because the Ebisu-jinja Shrine, worshipped by fishermen and other sea faring folk is located there.
This is because the Ebisu-jinja Shrine, worshipped by fishermen and other sea faring folk is located there.

sen.j: 以前は、幸福・知恵・財福をもたらす七福神の弁財天が祭られていたが現在は、対岸の城山（耳鼻地区）の愛宕神社の下に移築されている。
sen.e: In the past, Benzaiten, which is one of Shichifukujin (seven deities of good luck) and is said to bring happiness, knowledge and finalcail benefits, was also located there, but was moved now to a place below Atago-jinja Shrine in Shiroyama (the Mimihana area) on the main land area facing this island.

In the past, Benzaiten, one of the Shichifukujin (seven deities of good luck) said to bring happiness, knowledge and financial benefits, was also located there, but was moved to a place below Atago-jinja Shrine in Shiroyama (the Mimihana area) on the main land area facing this island.

In the past, Benzaiten, one of the Shichifukujin (seven deities of good luck) said to bring happiness, knowledge and financial benefits, was also located there, but was moved to a place below Atago-jinja Shrine in Shiroyama (the Mimihana area) on the main land area facing this island.

sen.j: 加えて、昭和中期までは墓所も存在していたため、余計にこうした島の位置づけ・性格が形成・定着していくこととなった。
sen.e: In addition, graves were placed there until around the middle of the Showa era, and this fact also aided the positioning and characteristics of this island in being formed and fixed.
In addition, graves were located here until around the middle of the Showa era. This fact also helped place and form the status and characteristics of this island.
In addition, graves were located here until around the middle of the Showa period; this fact also helped place and form the status and characteristics of this island.

sen.j: 青島の「青」は「碧」で死や信仰にも通じる。
sen.e: 青 of 青島 (Aoshima Island) indicates 碧 which is related to death or worship
青 of 青島 (Aoshima Island) indicates 碧 which is related to death or worship.
青 of 青島 (Aoshima Island) indicates 碧 which is related to death or worship.

sen.j: 文字通り、名は体を表していると言える。
sen.e: It can be said that this is an exact examplle of the proverb of "Names and natures often agree."
It can be said that this is an exact example of the proverb of "Names and natures often agree."
It can be said that this is an exact example of the proverb of "Names and natures often agree."

sen.j: 大正から昭和に掛けては、国防上の要衝として旧海軍に買い上げられ、魚雷発射基地にもなった。
sen.e: In the period from the Taisho era to the Showa era, this island was procured by the former Japanese navy for national defense, being used as a base for firing torpedoes as well.
This island was procured by the former Japanese navy for national defense, and also used as a base for firing torpedoes from the Taisho to Showa era.
This island was procured by the former Japanese navy for national defense, and also used as a base for firing torpedoes from the Taisho to the Showa period.
sen.cmt: period としました。"the" を挿入しました。

sen.j: 島民と呼べる人々は、神社の神主や土産物店の関係者など一部であり、僅少。
sen.e: The persons who can be called an islander are few, only the priest of the shrine and the persons rleated to the sourvenir shops.
Persons who can be counted as islanders are few and include only the priest of the shrine and persons releated to the souvenir shops.
Persons who can be counted as islanders are few and include only the priest of the shrine and persons related to the souvenir shops.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: その反面、陸から200mもないので素人のゴムボートですら渡船が容易であり、一大釣りスポットと化している。
sen.e: On the other hand, being located in less than 200 m from the main land, the island can be easily reached by rubber boats and has become a big fishing site.
On the other hand, being located in less than 200 m from the main land, the island can be easily reached by rubber boats and has become a big fishing site.
On the other hand, being located in less than 200 m from the main land, the island can be easily reached by rubber boats and has become a big fishing site.

sen.j: 内湾なので波浪が少なく比較的安全である。
sen.e: Being placed within a bay, the area is a relatively safe place with waves being quiet.
Being placed within a bay, the area is relatively safe with quiet waves.
Being placed within a bay, the area is relatively safe with quiet waves.

sen.j: 対象魚は、クロダイやメジナ、フグといった磯ものの定番のほか、ブリやシマアジなどの回遊もあり、鯛やイカも期待できる。
sen.e: In addition to the basic species of Japanese black porgies, the largescale llackfishes and the blow fishes, the target fishes there also include migratory ones, such as Japanese amberjacks and striped jacks, with the coming of sea breams and squids being expected as well.

In addition to the basic species of Japanese black porgies, largescale black fish and blow fish, the area harbors migratory fish such as Japanese amberjacks and striped jacks, with some sea breams and squid as well.

In addition to the basic species of Japanese black porgies, largescale black fish and blow fish, the area harbors migratory fish such as Japanese amberjacks and striped jacks, with some sea breams and squid as well.

sen.j: 大自然の中で釣りを通じて癒される場所である。
sen.e: The island is a place where pople are refreshed through fishing in wonderful nature.
The island provides refreshment for people through fishing.
The island provides refreshment for people through fishing.

tit.j: 他ネット接続サービス
tit.e: Services of making a connection to other networks.
